channel.title: How to get server for others to play too
channel.description:
[size=24pt]NEW READ PLEASE[/size]
What Ip do i set up on no-ip.org. I have several diffrent ip's and idk what one to use thanks!
And I portfowarded my I pv4 address but i put my external ip in the no-ip setup will it still work like that?? Cause im lost lol

item.title: How to get server for others to play too
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Yes you need to download no-ip and make one but the no-ip that you make does not need to be portforwarded on your router. The no-ip is so that people won’t get your actually computer ip to send like virsus

Read full topic
item.source: How to get server for others to play too

item.title: How to get server for others to play too
item.dc:creator: @HIGHK9 HIGHK9
item.description:
@HIGHK9 wrote:

Ok thank you 1 more thing I already portfowarded my ip useing my router do i need to download no-ip and get a ip from that and portfoward that ip and use that one? Why cant I just use the one i have and not the no-ip thingy? thanks

Read full topic
item.source: How to get server for others to play too

item.title: How to get server for others to play too
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Q1.So what one do I put in all the 127.0.0.1 place’s my ip that i portforwarded correct?

A1. You make a no-ip from no-ip.com and replace it with the 127.0.0.1

Q2.I make it into a .rar file and go to megaupload or something like that and make it into a downloadable for others.

A2. Yes

Q3.But i change the ip on the one on my computer to 0.0.0.0 right? or leave it as the same ip they will be useing?

A3. You change it back to 127.0.0.1 after you have uploaded it to a site, so that you can login.

Q4.And do I have to keep my computer on to keep the server on? and do I have to keep my game on/open for it to still be on for them? thanks a ton I cant believe I got this far!!

A4. Yes you have to keep your computer on with the server running, you do not have to keep the client on that is only to allow you to connect on it from your computer.

Read full topic

[quote=“ston3, post:4, topic:442395”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=545025.msg3995338#msg3995338 date=1337200335]
You can use µTorrent as a secondary if your router isn’t working.
[/quote]uTorrent never seems to work for anyone at all. Doubt it would work for him[/quote]

It doesn’t work if you don’t set it up properly.

item.title: How to get server for others to play too
item.dc:creator: @ston3 ston3
item.description:
@ston3 wrote:

If you cannot host it, you need to buy a vps (virtual private server) to host it, or have someone host it for you. Slicehost is a good choice for a VPS, but there are plenty out there. 2nd of all, you can always make a webclient if you cannot figure out how to allow players to onto your client.

Hope I helped

Read full topic
